page.title: 01Introduction (l)
page.content:
Bickmarsh,Cleeve Prior, The Littletons,and Ullington is a country area comprised of farms and market gardens. The land is gently undulating varying between thirty eight and fifty three metres above sea level. There are eight farms growing a wide variety of crops from cereal to hay for silage. Oil seed rape has become popular and has a government subsidy. Many of the market gardens are small family concerns, they are kept very busy the whole year and grow cabbages, cauliflowers, beans, tomatoes, carrots, leeks, spring onions, sprouts and rhubarb. This area is nationally famous for market garden produce. A few orchards have been left in the area but many have been grubbed up in the last decade.
